It also offers PediMag and PediVAS extracorporeal full-flow acute surgical support platforms incorporating a polycarbonate pump, based on magnetically levitated bearingless motor technology, designed to provide acute surgical support to pediatric patients. In addition, it provides Thoratec Paracorporeal Ventricular Assist Device (PVAD) an external, pulsatile ventricular assist device (VAD), FDA-approved for bridge-to-transplantation (BTT) and post-cardiotomy myocardial recovery; and Thoratec Implantable Ventricular Assist Device (IVAD) an implantable, pulsatile, VAD, FDA-approved for BTT, including home discharge, and post-cardiotomy myocardial recovery and provides left, right or biventricular MCS The company markets its products through cardiovascular sales specialists and distributors in the United States and internationally. Thoratec Corporation was founded in 1976 and is headquartered in Pleasanton, California. Thoratec Corp. operates as a subsidiary of St. Jude Medical, LLC.

name: Telcred
description: Telcred AB provides software service for physical access control, designed and developed from the ground up to advantage the cloud, smartphones, and Internet protocol. Its solutions allow near-field communication (NFC) devices, including mobile phones to be used for access control instead of or in addition to traditional keys and smart cards. The company’s PACS components include backend systems for creating and managing user accounts, defining and assigning access rights to users, and sending access rights to the users' devices; NFC devices that store access rights and communicate them to the NFC reader at the time of access; NFC reader that communicates with the NFC device at the time of access and sends the access rights on to the lock controller; and lock controller, which receives the access rights from the NFC reader and verifies them. Its products can be integrated with traditional PACS and electric locking solutions from various vendors. The company offers its solution to installers, end customers, and original equipment manufacturers (OEM). Telcred AB was founded in 2009 and is based in Stockholm, Sweden.

The company designs, develops, tests, and markets FuelShield, a system that protects aircraft fuel tanks against hydrodynamic ram, fire, and explosion. The company also provides advisory services, such as threat analysis, risk assessment, vulnerability analysis, code review, penetration testing, incident response, and cyber threat intelligence. Kristian Kassow was working on an analysis of the requirements for robots in the food industry. Meanwhile, Esben Østergaard and Kasper Støy were working on a PhD project about the market for robots. Together, they discovered that the robotics market is characterised by heavy, expensive, and unwieldy robots. Based on their experience, they decided, with help from investor Syddansk Innovation, to establish Universal Robots with the intention of making robot technology available to all. name: Argus
description: Argus Cyber Security Ltd. provides a ready-to-embed cyber security solution suite for automobiles and aftermarket connectivity platforms. The company helps car manufacturers, their Tier 1 suppliers, and aftermarket connectivity providers protect connected cars and commercial vehicles from car-hacking. Its solution suite includes ARGUS IN-VEHICLE NETWORK PROTECTION, which provides in-vehicle network-wide security by detecting attacks, suspicious activity, and changes in standard in-vehicle network behavior; ARGUS CONNECTIVITY PROTECTION, which defends the infotainment or telematics units by preventing malware installation, detecting operating system anomalies, isolating suspicious applications, and stopping attacks spreading to the in-vehicle network; ARGUS ECU PROTECTION, which reinforces select electronic control units (ECUs), such as brakes, advanced driver assistance systems, door control units, and other units deemed critical from attacks originating inside and outside of the ECU; ARGUS LIFESPAN PROTECTION, which collects and analyzes data from ARGUS IN-VEHICLE solutions and other sources; and ARGUS AFTERMARKET PROTECTION, which delivers telematics technology providers, connectivity service providers, fleet managers, insurance companies, and dongle manufacturers’ solutions that protect cars from attacks exploiting their technologies and services. The company also provides advisory services, such as threat analysis, risk assessment, vulnerability analysis, code review, penetration testing, incident response, and cyber threat intelligence. Argus Cyber Security Ltd. was founded in 2013 and is based in Tel Aviv, Israel with additional offices in Michigan, the Silicon Valley, Stuttgart, and Tokyo. name: ShieldIOT
description: ShieldIoT develops an IoT embedded device-level security solution that enables device manufacturers to secure their devices without any development resources or security expertise. The company’s product includes ShieldIOT which is an application and hardware agnostic technology platform that protects any Linux-based device, across IoT networks without any changes to the device, application, or the network. The company serves governments, military forces, and private companies worldwide operating in financial services; energy and utilities; defense; manufacturing and supply; legal; human resources; transportation; media and entertainment; technology; telecommunications; healthcare; pharmaceuticals; non-profit; and retail and e-commerce industries. Darktrace Limited was founded in 2013 and is based in Cambridge, United Kingdom with additional offices in the United States, Canada, the Netherlands, the United Kingdom, Italy, France, Sweden, Poland, New Zealand, Australia, Hong Kong, South Korea, Singapore, India, Japan, United Arab Emirates, South Africa, Brazil, and Colombia.

The company operates through four business units: Filters, Power Systems, Air Pollution Control, and Airborne Molecular Contamination. The Filters business unit provides air filtration solutions for air handling systems in housing, office buildings and hotels, and other facilities, as well as schools and hospitals, and other public buildings. The Power Systems business unit offers air inlet systems, exhaust systems, acoustic enclosures, ventilation systems, and heavy-duty air filters for gas turbines. It also provides a range of services, including upgrading and retrofitting of existing systems and filter replacements. The Air Pollution Control business unit develops, manufactures, and sells equipment and filters for dust collection. Its dust collectors remove smoke and dust from industrial processes to create a clean and safe work environment within process and engineering industries. The Airborne Molecular Contamination business unit specializes in solving filtration problems in the microelectronics industry, which has production processes with stringent requirements for clean air. It offers advanced filtration systems that remove undesired molecular gases and contaminants. The company serves customers in various industries, including automotive, airports, microelectronics, food and beverage, hospitals, life science, dust collectors, nuclear, gas turbines and other power systems, laboratories and bio-safety labs, museums, and schools and universities, as well as commercial, retail, and office buildings. The company provides feedwater treatment programs for high-pressure water tube boilers, fire tube boilers, and steam generators; and water treatment programs for industrial and commercial evaporative cooling systems. In addition, it offers custom water treatment systems for new buildings and renovations of existing facilities. Further, the company provides laboratory, training, and inspection, as well as field services. Its products and services extend the life of boilers, chillers, cooling towers, process heat exchangers, and piping systems, as well as reduce utility plant operating costs by minimizing water and energy consumption. The company serves manufacturing plants, co-generation facilities, colleges and universities, hospitals and medical centers, military bases, correctional facilities, and commercial office buildings in North America. Barclay Water Management, Inc. was formerly known as Barclay Chemical Company, Inc. and changed its name to Barclay Water Management, Inc. in May 1995.
